content: Write a sonnet about the sea, ensuring each line begins with a different letter of the alphabet.

A boundless expanse where horizons meet the sky,

Beneath the moon's gentle, silvery light,

Crimson sunsets paint the waves goodbye,

Dancing foam, a symphony in white.

Eternal ebb and flow, a rhythmic song,

Fathomless depths, mysteries untold,

Glistening pearls within its depths belong,

Hiding secrets, young and old.

I stand upon the shore, heart full of awe,

Jewels of salt, kissed by the breeze,

Kneeling to the might of nature's law,

Lulled by the whispers of the seas.

Majestic, mighty, mother of all life,

Nurturing, sustaining, in endless strife.
